meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or effort.
meanings.sent1: The slacker always finds excuses to skip doing any work.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a slacker and help with the chores around the house.
meanings.sent3: The slacker tried to convince everyone that napping was a form of exercise.
meanings.sent4: She was a slacker in the race, lagging behind everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The image of the slacker lounging on the couch instead of working was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or idle.
meanings.sent1: My brother is such a slacker, always avoiding responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The slacker spent the whole day watching TV without doing anything productive.
meanings.sent3: The slacker's idea of a workout was lifting the remote control.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a slacker compared to her hardworking colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The lazy slacker lounged around while others were busy working.
